required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Polymorphism and Post Operative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV)
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Polymorphism Associated With the Occurrence of Postoperative Vomiting and Vomiting (PONV) in Patients Undergoing Oncological Surgeries

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

clinical_study.source: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: Nausea and vomiting affects 25-30% of individuals in the post-operative period and can reach more than 70-80% in high-risk patients. inherited factors may play a significant role in individual susceptibility and clinical research on hereditary factors involved in the pathogenesis of Postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) and chemotherapy nausea and vomiting (CINV) is relatively new. The aim of this study is to investigate whether inter-individual differences related to PONV are associated with genetic factors. 300 patients will be evaluated in postoperative oncological surgeries. The peripheral leukocyte DNA will be extracted by the Salting Out Procedure method and processed to genotyping for 48 SNPs from 15 candidate genes by real-time PCR by the Taqman method. The possible associations with demographic data and factors related to surgery will be analyzed by univariate and multivariate analysis.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate whether inter-individual differences related to PONV are associated with genetic factors. 300 patients will be evaluated in postoperative oncological surgeries. The peripheral leukocyte DNA will be extracted by the Salting Out Procedure method and processed to genotyping for 48 single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) from 15 candidate genes by real-time PCR by the Taqman method. The possible associations with demographic data and factors related to surgery will be analyzed by univariate and multivariate analysis.

primary_outcome.description: Genetic polymorphism of candidate genes associated to PONV or noPONV

arm_group.description: Patients presenting with postoperative nausea and vomiting
Patients not presenting with postoperative nausea and vomiting

intervention.description: DNA will be extracted from white cells

study_pop.textblock: 300 Patients submitted to cancer surgery, classified as high-risk for PONV according to Apfel Score, 150 cases and 150 controls.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- High-risk patients for PONV
Exclusion Criteria:
- Low risk patients for PONV

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

facility.name: Cancer Institute of the State of Sao Paulo - ICESP
Cancer Institute of the State of Sao Paulo

results_reference.citation: Hayase T, Sugino S, Moriya H, Yamakage M. TACR1 gene polymorphism and sex differences in postoperative nausea and vomiting. Anaesthesia. 2015 Oct;70(10):1148-59. doi: 10.1111/anae.13082. Epub 2015 May 27.

Wesmiller SW, Bender CM, Sereika SM, Ahrendt G, Bonaventura M, Bovbjerg DH, Conley Y. Association between serotonin transport polymorphisms and postdischarge nausea and vomiting in women following breast cancer surgery. Oncol Nurs Forum. 2014 Mar 1;41(2):195-202. doi: 10.1188/14.ONF.195-202.

patient_data.ipd_description: The researchers make a plan to share informations via Red Cap
